bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton, October 1, 1889
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consular General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, October 1st, 1889
Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Accounts and returns for the quarter ended September 30th, 1889
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, October 1st, 1889
Honorable William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State, Wasington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to transmit herein the accounts and returns of this Consular District for the quarter ended September 30th 1889, as per enclosures. No American vessel has been in port during the quarter.
I am, sir, your obedient servant,
E. E. Smith U.S. Consul General
1. Rent and Abstract of contingent expenses 2. statement of account for contingent expenses 3. Statement of accounts for Salary
